text: Good techniques used here...
Hey thanks Graham! I'm always looking for ideas for new tutorials!

Thank you! You're a great teacher.
Thanks so much for dropping by to check my stuff out!

Hi Mike, I'm just starting out with Photoshop and your tutorial is brilliant! You explain so clearly every step of the process - even what controls to use, brush size etc and don't take the simplest things for granted eg that someone knows how to copy one image onto another. Will definitely watch out for more and have just subscribed to your channel. Thanks a million!??
Thank you so much for checking out my videos and I'm really glad you enjoyed this one!  Feel free to send me ideas for new tutorials.

hey. I saw couple of you tutorials and they are really good. But I have  task in PS I cannot handle. I want to replace one object of some shape and  form with another object and I want it in same shape and form. Example: I  have picture of my friend with flag around his neck and on shoulders in  pose. so flag is curved, wavy and shady. Now I want to replace it with  other flag, but I want it to keep form of the old flag is this even  possible? If anyone can help or send link to the proper video I will  appreciate it. T.Hanks
if you paint black on the mask you want the background to come through.  Once you have done that click CNTRL I or Comand I on a mac.That is the shortcut for Invert see if that helps you.
when i copy paste the picture i need, the opacity is really low ?although it says 100%. HELP????
Okay instead of copy paste try to drag the second image from the folder it's in right on top of the first image which is already open in photoshop.?
Hi, I'm having a problem with this. The brush option is not working for CS3! Is their any way to make the brush work?

If you see your paint strokes actually showing up on the image then you need to make sure you have the layer mask selected.  On the layer you are painting on you should see a small thumbnail of the image and to the right of that a small thumbnail of the mask which will either be all white or all black. Make sure you click directly on the mask thumbnail and then paint.?

I found this tutorial also helpful  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=StBOo5RsHds
you can use Ctrl+Alt+J to add new layer instead of clicking the menu.
for transform tool Ctrl+T is a good shortcut. I regularly use it.
Where is the add layer button in adobe photoshop lightroom version 5? I could not find it.
It is very difficult to create new layer in adobe photoshop lightroom. use any version of photoshop instead of lightroom
I found it good practice to brush with around the edge of the photo that you are going to blend.
Make sure that the brush is always soft otherwise there will be some hard border.
What is the shortcut for bringing the brush pallet? I did not get it.
please do Ctrl-Click in Image window. that would open up the brush pallet.
make sure to lower the opacity. otherwise the result won't be that good

When I was working with photoshop CC I found it helpful to check the opacity before starting the task. So that it does not accidently changes!
In photoshop elements 2011 it is difficult to control the opacity option. I would suggest to be careful when you are using brush.
Photoshop elements dont have this kind brush pallet. For better brush I would recommend to google!
I have a suggestion! Photoshop CC version has lots of different brushes! user those! I got beautiful output!!
If you are using phothsop CS3 then use a medium hard brush. the output result is really nice!!
Sometimes there are problems with creating layer. In that case sometimes you need to restart photoshop.
Transfrom tool is bit different in PS elements. Sometimes it does not work properly. in many cases I needed to restart my PS!
